intro: Chaenorhinum origanifolium subsp. glareosum, commonly known as the golden chaenorhinum, is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its slender, branched stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a distinctive aromatic scent. It produces clusters of small, tubular, yellow-orange flowers that bloom from summer to autumn. This plant is native to southern Europe and thrives in well-drained soils in sunny to partially shaded environments.
